file_insights.changes: Updated project state tracking - incremented completed subtasks from 3 to 4, changed phase from 'Landing Page Integration' to 'Responsive Design Verification', updated session number from 4 to 5, and refreshed timestamps
file_insights.significance: Workflow state management reflecting successful completion of responsive design testing subtask
file_insights.impact: Administrative/tracking only - no functional code impact

file_insights.significance: Build artifact hash change indicating frontend rebuild after source modifications

file_insights.changes: Removed console.log statement from handleRequestDemo function
file_insights.impact: Minor - improves production code quality by removing development artifacts

patterns_discovered.description: Project uses auto-generated status file tracking subtask completion, session numbers, and phase progression
patterns_discovered.relevance: Indicates automated CI/CD or build tracking system

patterns_discovered.description: Responsive design verification resulted in only one functional code change (console.log removal)
patterns_discovered.relevance: Suggests testing was validation-focused rather than implementation-focused; responsive code likely already in place

patterns_discovered.description: Each source change triggers new hashed JavaScript asset names in dist folder
patterns_discovered.relevance: Standard Vite/modern bundler behavior for cache busting

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: Minimal Code Changes for Testing Subtask
gotchas_discovered.description: Testing responsive behavior and accessibility required only debug statement removal, not actual feature implementation
gotchas_discovered.implication: Responsive design and accessibility features were already implemented in previous subtasks; this subtask was verification-focused

gotchas_discovered.description: The .auto-claude-status file suggests automated tracking but requires manual updates to reflect completion
gotchas_discovered.implication: Workflow management may not be fully automated; could lead to status file drift

approach_outcome.summary: Responsive design testing and accessibility verification completed successfully
deliverables: Validated responsive behavior at key breakpoints

recommendations.recommendation: Implement linting rules to automatically catch and prevent console.log statements in production code
recommendations.rationale: Debug statements were manually removed; automated detection would prevent this

recommendations.recommendation: Document which breakpoints were tested for responsive design to ensure consistent coverage across team
recommendations.rationale: Minimal code changes suggest testing was already passing; documentation would validate test coverage

recommendations.recommendation: Consider fully automating status file updates via CI/CD pipeline rather than manual updates
recommendations.rationale: Current manual status updates could lead to inconsistencies or drift

recommendations.recommendation: Add accessibility testing tools (e.g., axe, pa11y) to automated test suite to catch issues earlier
recommendations.rationale: Accessibility verification completed in this subtask; automated testing would prevent regressions
